New Records: Jokic joins Westbrook (Apr. 2, 2019) as the 2nd player to record a 20/20/15 game since Wilt Chamberlain in 1968!
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 23 points, 20 rebounds, and 16 assists
Peyton Watson made a game-sealing block with one second left
Denver Nuggets went ahead 103-99 when Westbrook converted a three-point play, Porter sank a 3-pointer, and Westbrook added another basket
Oklahoma City Thunder reeled off the next seven points to go up 106-103
Braun and Watson sank 3-pointers and Julian Strawther had a putback dunk during an 11-5 run that gave Denver a 123-115 lead
Williams scored five straight to make it 123-120 entering the final minute
Jokic split a pair of free throws with 27 seconds left, Gilgeous-Alexander made a layup, and Watson missed two foul shots, leaving Oklahoma City within two
Watson blocked Gilgeous-Alexanderâ€™s last-second floater to preserve the win
Post-Match Reflections: Denver Nuggets played without Jamal Murray (concussion protocol) for the third straight game and without Aaron Gordon, who will miss multiple weeks due to a right calf strain
Miscellaneous Highlights: Denver Nuggets used a 40-point third quarter to storm back
